post.body:
"Nintendo" (which used to like his vids) apparently sent him a Cease and Desist letter demanding he stop using Nintendo references on his channels. Well apparently using the human puppets was not enough and now he said all his channels are being taken down June 1st 2021 which is tomorrow! I wish this was a joke but it's not, here's the proof! https://www.youtube.com/sml/community

I kind of wonder whether it was actually Nintendo or if it was really someone else trying to fake excuses to wipe out all remaining channels that aren't directly under the control of Google Inc. We know YouTube hates SML's guts, and in the past 2 years especially we've seen most of the old YouTubers quit (ExplodingTNT, PinkSheep), get rebranded by YouTube Inc. (SMG4), or get demonetized or terminated for no reason, to be replaced by completely obvious plants and hired YouTubers who instantly gain massive visibility with zero effort (Dream). Google probably knows SML is the last major remnant of pre-monetization YouTube, and while he too likes big bucks he's too stubborn to bend to their wishes all the time and won't make videos just to help them make more money. Everyone else who isn't part of the marketing scheme is either dead or buried below everything else and never sees the light of day, SML being one of the last survivors from the old days and they know it's not advertiser-friendly nor good for their desire to control everything like 1984.

post.body:
Some Christians might have trouble with creationism or with the resurrection, but for me it's the Church. I just don't know anymore... 

A few months ago, my husband and I (both lifelong Protestants) started examining our faith when we realized that we decided we wanted our own home church. I knew that despite being Baptist/Nondenominational, I wanted something traditional and grounded, so we considered everything, including Catholic and Orthodox Christianity. The Episcopalian church our friends invited us to had a giant BLM display, an old lady pastor (which, sorry, I don't believe is biblical) and liturgy that was almost entirely written post-1970. We didn't even get through the doors of the Lutheran church with all of its Gay Pride/Hate Has No Home Here symbology around the front lawn. My husband and I have opposite experiences with Catholicism (I've known many incredible and inspiring Catholics, but he basically assumes its the anti-church), so that became a no-go. For a while, I was really excited about Orthodox Christianity, and we have a church only five minutes from our house. But the mask mandates made conversation almost impossible, and we were very confused about icons, and my husband decided it was all too weird for him.

In the end, he's doubling down on fundamentalism at present, while I'm increasingly questioning Protestantism as a whole. It's been almost ten years since I had a church. It was non-denominational, and while I liked it, it experienced a 3-way split in the end. Ugly stuff. I miss a church community. I'm puzzled when I read books like I Timothy and can't find anything matching the description... at least that we're both on board with. Sometimes I feel like it's never going to happen.

No, we haven't had any fights. We're both very understanding of each other's views. It's just frustrating that we keep siding differently. Prayers seriously appreciated!

TLDR: My husband and I can't agree on a denomination. The process is tiring, and I miss going to church!

body: You should probably withdraw from mainstream Christianity for the moment. Most of it only still stands so they can use God's name for a political cause, and they all promote it. And when everyone else is doing something it's really hard not to blindly follow along yourself. I guarantee you once this culture war is over "Christians" are going to drop like flies since they have no use for that identity anymore, and we'll see how many of them were even true believers at all or just using the label for identity politics. Most of them are really traditionalists and only choose Christianity because it has a high prominence in America's past, and they want to bring that back, not actually follow the faith. You can see this clearly by how "Christian values" have more to do with social norms of America's past than anything coming from the first century. Speaking of the first century, there was a similar situation then where the Jewish mainstream was becoming ultra-zealous and concerned only about winning against the "pagans" and thought the messiah was an ultra warrior who would come and win for them so they could enslave the whole world for themselves.

body:
> Sexual sins are the only kind of sins we're told to **flee** from (1 Corinthians) and there's probably a reason

That's an excuse someone came up with to do everything you want as long as it isn't *that*. Are you denying that you're supposed to flee from *all* evil? Furthermore, divorce and sexual objectification of others are usually tolerated and they definitely fall under that umbrella. And if it's so important why does Jesus barely mention it?

> I have just as much a problem with this as I have with my uncle who devoted his wife and married another woman.

Actions speak louder than words. I don't know what else *you* post but I see a heck of a lot of posts from people about this but never about divorce.

> I hate gluttony more than homosexuality, but it's not a sin that we're told to flee from. That's the difference.

You're basically saying, "we may do everything except what Paul said to flee from one time when he was addressing that specific issue". Paul didn't think that. Let's take a look at his logic here:

> 5:1It is actually reported that there is immorality among you, and immorality of such a kind as does not exist even among the Gentiles, that someone has his father‚Äôs wife. 2You have become arrogant and have not mourned instead, so that the one who had done this deed would be removed from your midst.
> 
> [6Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough? 7Clean out the old leaven so that you may be a new lump, just as you are in fact unleavened. For Christ our Passover also has been sacrificed. 8Therefore let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.]
> 
> 9I wrote you in my letter not to associate with immoral people; 10I did not at all mean with the immoral people of this world, or with the covetous and swindlers, or with idolaters, for then you would have to go out of the world. 11But actually, I wrote to you not to associate with anyone called a brother if he is an immoral person, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or a swindler‚Äînot even to eat with such a one. 13 Remove the wicked man from among yourselves.
> 
> [6:12All things are permitted for me, but not all things are of benefit. All things are permitted for me, but I will not be mastered by anything.] [13Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food, however God will do away with both of them.] Now the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body. 14Now God has not only raised the Lord, but will also raise us up through His power. 15Do you not know that your bodies are parts of Christ? Shall I then take away the parts of Christ and make them parts of a prostitute? Far from it! 16Or do you not know that the one who joins himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For He says, ‚ÄúThe two will become one flesh.‚Äù 17But the one who joins himself to the Lord is one spirit with Him. 18Flee sexual immorality. Every other sin that a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against his own body. 19Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own? 20For you have been bought for a price: therefore glorify God in your body.

Basically, the point being made by verses 18-20 is "Outsiders are seeing this and they're going to think this is what Christians do! And you are also tempting your brothers! Don't become associated with this!". He's not telling them *not* to worry about anything that isn't sexual. He's just trying to explain to them that they shouldn't commit adultery like that, because that's what they were doing. The bit about the body vs outside the body is just Paul giving them his explanation for what's wrong with it, because that part is somewhat unique about it. But he's not trying to put it in some special category of worse and unforgivable sin, nor would he be correct if he really did so.
body_html:
Sexual sins are the only kind of sins we're told to flee from (1 Corinthians) and there's probably a reason

That's an excuse someone came up with to do everything you want as long as it isn't that. Are you denying that you're supposed to flee from all evil? Furthermore, divorce and sexual objectification of others are usually tolerated and they definitely fall under that umbrella. And if it's so important why does Jesus barely mention it?

I have just as much a problem with this as I have with my uncle who devoted his wife and married another woman.

Actions speak louder than words. I don't know what else you post but I see a heck of a lot of posts from people about this but never about divorce.

I hate gluttony more than homosexuality, but it's not a sin that we're told to flee from. That's the difference.

You're basically saying, "we may do everything except what Paul said to flee from one time when he was addressing that specific issue". Paul didn't think that. Let's take a look at his logic here:

5:1It is actually reported that there is immorality among you, and immorality of such a kind as does not exist even among the Gentiles, that someone has his father‚Äôs wife. 2You have become arrogant and have not mourned instead, so that the one who had done this deed would be removed from your midst.

[6Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough? 7Clean out the old leaven so that you may be a new lump, just as you are in fact unleavened. For Christ our Passover also has been sacrificed. 8Therefore let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.]

9I wrote you in my letter not to associate with immoral people; 10I did not at all mean with the immoral people of this world, or with the covetous and swindlers, or with idolaters, for then you would have to go out of the world. 11But actually, I wrote to you not to associate with anyone called a brother if he is an immoral person, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or a swindler‚Äînot even to eat with such a one. 13 Remove the wicked man from among yourselves.

[6:12All things are permitted for me, but not all things are of benefit. All things are permitted for me, but I will not be mastered by anything.] [13Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food, however God will do away with both of them.] Now the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body. 14Now God has not only raised the Lord, but will also raise us up through His power. 15Do you not know that your bodies are parts of Christ? Shall I then take away the parts of Christ and make them parts of a prostitute? Far from it! 16Or do you not know that the one who joins himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For He says, ‚ÄúThe two will become one flesh.‚Äù 17But the one who joins himself to the Lord is one spirit with Him. 18Flee sexual immorality. Every other sin that a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against his own body. 19Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own? 20For you have been bought for a price: therefore glorify God in your body.

Basically, the point being made by verses 18-20 is "Outsiders are seeing this and they're going to think this is what Christians do! And you are also tempting your brothers! Don't become associated with this!". He's not telling them not to worry about anything that isn't sexual. He's just trying to explain to them that they shouldn't commit adultery like that, because that's what they were doing. The bit about the body vs outside the body is just Paul giving them his explanation for what's wrong with it, because that part is somewhat unique about it. But he's not trying to put it in some special category of worse and unforgivable sin, nor would he be correct if he really did so.

post.body:
So, about a few days ago, I received a message from YouTube about a claim that had been made on my video.

"Hi FB3 Network,

A copyright owner using Content ID has claimed some material in your video.

Your video is live and the visibility settings you selected remain applied to it. But it is now either being monetized by the copyright owner, or they have chosen to receive analytics about it.

This is not a copyright strike. This claim does not affect your account status.

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase
Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You
Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com"

2 days ago, I filed a dispute against this claim because the audio was used for less than 30 seconds and the music plays before every race, so I went ahead and filed my dispute.
	
"Hi FB3 Network,

The following claim on video Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase has been disputed:

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase
Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You
Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com

Reason for dispute: Approval from copyright holder is not required. It is fair use under copyright law."

And today, I got a email from YouTube about 30 - 40 minutes ago. It was a really, really good and surprising email. Something I always dreamt of happening.

"Hi FB3 Network,

Good news! After reviewing your dispute, License.Monstercat.com has decided to release their copyright claim on your YouTube video.

Video title: "Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase"

- The YouTube Team"

I ACTUALLY CAN'T BELIEVE I ACTUALLY WON A DISPUTE!!!

body: Actually the admins are probably some of the only neurotypicals on the site. And some of their closest discord pals. Probably part of the reason why they fall into a typical clique so easily where they idolize their hierarchy and shit on outsiders, and everyone else gets so annoyed but it prevails regardless. NTs as bad as it is are very accustomed to these kinds of social orders and often cannot see the faults in themselves nor the tribe they've become loyalist to, aka groupthink. This also explains how everyone can fit so neatly into two major parties which are so ideologically inconsistent, because it's more about in-group loyalty than having an actual philosophy. So my guess is that most of the normies are completely fine with and even idolize how sites like reddit are run and only the oddballs end up needing to leave for something less restrictive. Unfortunately we also suck at marketing so the NTs making fake new "free speech" sites that don't stay that way for long always win out.

body:
> I saw some people who also have this extreme position, that church is bad, there is nothing good there and only way is to abandon it and go alone.

Nearly every biblical character moved away from organized religion and faced huge conflicts with it. Actually you can make a pretty good argument that it largely contributed to the death of Jesus. Anything that gives humans power is a ripoff to control people.

> It truly is a problem of (not only) today's church that God kinda disappeared from the centre of our lives and it is all just a tradition, a custom to us.

I can't think of any time when God was actually popular. The human race as a whole is hostile to him.

> You can always find, maybe just a little group of people, with whom you can share your spiritual life. Because that is what we do. We have people with whom we share our earthly life, and just like that, we need them for our spiritual life too. And sometimes you just need to hear words from others, because you can not objectively judge yourself, and how bad/good it is with you.

That's not a church, that's a social family.

> And you are wrong that we can not conquer anything from his reign. By yourself, definitely not, you might just get yourself killed. But that's the point of having fellowship with other Christians. Together we can conquer our household/ our school /our work for God. Because we have God on our side.

You underestimate the power of the dark side. Evil always wins here save for a few cases where God directly intervenes. And conquering others is a demonic primal desire in the first place! Why didn't Jesus just cut the crap and destroy Rome so the Pharisees could take over the world already? Because he wasn't here to do that, they just wanted him to because of their superiority fetish which seems to be ingrained in humans. You have no right to complain about the things being done to you if you're just going to turn around and do the same things to them, yet that's how everybody acts. Therefore if you're out to get your opponents, you are really no different from them. And don't start telling yourself, "God is on our side," because he shows no favoritism.

I saw some people who also have this extreme position, that church is bad, there is nothing good there and only way is to abandon it and go alone.

Nearly every biblical character moved away from organized religion and faced huge conflicts with it. Actually you can make a pretty good argument that it largely contributed to the death of Jesus. Anything that gives humans power is a ripoff to control people.

It truly is a problem of (not only) today's church that God kinda disappeared from the centre of our lives and it is all just a tradition, a custom to us.

I can't think of any time when God was actually popular. The human race as a whole is hostile to him.

You can always find, maybe just a little group of people, with whom you can share your spiritual life. Because that is what we do. We have people with whom we share our earthly life, and just like that, we need them for our spiritual life too. And sometimes you just need to hear words from others, because you can not objectively judge yourself, and how bad/good it is with you.

That's not a church, that's a social family.

And you are wrong that we can not conquer anything from his reign. By yourself, definitely not, you might just get yourself killed. But that's the point of having fellowship with other Christians. Together we can conquer our household/ our school /our work for God. Because we have God on our side.

You underestimate the power of the dark side. Evil always wins here save for a few cases where God directly intervenes. And conquering others is a demonic primal desire in the first place! Why didn't Jesus just cut the crap and destroy Rome so the Pharisees could take over the world already? Because he wasn't here to do that, they just wanted him to because of their superiority fetish which seems to be ingrained in humans. You have no right to complain about the things being done to you if you're just going to turn around and do the same things to them, yet that's how everybody acts. Therefore if you're out to get your opponents, you are really no different from them. And don't start telling yourself, "God is on our side," because he shows no favoritism.

body:
> It's laughable you try to redefine the word instead of acknowledging what I have said. We can call it the administration of Grace if you prefer. You need to come to terms with the different administrations throughout human history.

You're still twisting the sentence. Paul is talking about *his* administration, aka his evangelist ministry that he was called to do, not eras.

> Again, ignoring what I have said. You are very foolish if you believe people born prior to Christ were justified unto eternal life the same way that I was. You need to study your bible instead of rejecting the parts you don't agree with or can't comprehend.

I have read stories in the old testament and yes, they *were* justified the same way, regardless of what the other parts say which are corrupt according to every reputable prophet. God doesn't change.

> oh ok, the old "this isn't literal" trick when scripture cuts through a flaw in your current understanding.

It's not figurative, but a code of condemnation isn't the idea, it's alluding to the Mosaic law because that's what most of the people watching the speech were accustomed to. The point is "don't be angry with your brother, don't hate your enemies, it's actually worse than you think murder is".

> You accuse Paul of having a pride issue, when it's your own pride that is the issue. You manipulate scripture in all ways I've seen and even disrespect the writer. There is no more to speak to you about.

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
>There are no dispensations and Paul is not "the" apostle to the gentiles, he is only one of them, of which they are many.

>There is no concept of dispensationalism at all in any bible I'm aware of. That was popularized by Scofield's notes. Paul isn't aware of it either, he preaches the same gospel to both Jews and gentiles.

Ephesians 3:2-13
2 If ye have heard of the **dispensation of the grace of God** which is given me to you-ward:
3 How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words,
4 Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)
5 **Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men**, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;

Ephesians 1:10
10 That in the** dispensation of the fulness of times** he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:

There are 7 Dispensations in the bible. These are two, the Gospel of the Kingdom was what Jesus and John the Baptist preached. The 12 Disciples also preached this to the Jewish remnant or "little flock", those that accepted Jesus as their king prior to the dispensation of Grace. The books of the bible following Philemon intended for Jews during The Great Tribulation or Time of Jacob's Trouble, also are The Gospel of the Kingdom for the Jewish Remnant. God returns to this dispensation after the period of Grace ends. There is also "The Law" which the Jews were under they agreed to at Mt. Sinai, and the instructions Adam and Eve were given. Different ways that God is dealing with humanity during different periods in history. You can't believe that the sermon on the mound is the same as the gospel of grace, unless you believe you can lose your salvation or that it is conditional upon works:

Matthew 5
22 But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, **shall be in danger of hell fire**.

Under the gospel of Grace we have eternal security in our salvation, dependant solely in our faith that Jesus died for our sins and was resurrected. 

>There is no concept of dispensationalism at all in any bible I'm aware of. That was popularized by Scofield's notes. Paul isn't aware of it either, he preaches the same gospel to both Jews and gentiles.

Yes Paul did preach the same Gospel to Jew and Gentile, because he is preaching during the dispensation of Grace. And I told you "Paul is the apostle to the gentiles and jews during the dispensation of Grace (which we live in)." It's the times before and after Paul's dispensation that are different. Within the dispensation of Grace both Jew and Gentile obtain God's gift of grace the same way, by faith alone. 

Paul is clearly aware that Christians are not under the Jewish law, but under Grace:

Romans 6
14 For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.
15 What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.

And as I quoted above, he was made aware of the dispensation of Grace, which was kept a mystery up until that point. Because Satan would have never killed Christ if he knew what it was going to do and provide to us. At the time he thought getting the Jews to reject Christ and kill him would have gave him a "victory".

>Paul is not "the" apostle to the gentiles, he is only one of them, of which they are many.

Oh yes, Paul is "the" apostle to (of whoops) the gentiles:

Romans 11:13
For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:
